info.game_comments: Richard Perez-Pena game 2. Missing J! Round.

(1, 1).clue: The 1st major American city to elect a socialist mayor, this Wisconsin city had them for 38 years

(2, 1).clue: He said, "No matter what , I will not resign"--3 days before he resigned in 1974

(3, 1).clue: Guinness says the largest parade of American flags, 13,000, took place in Honolulu on this date in 1985

(4, 1).clue: Chaucer, Spenser, Tennyson & Browning are all buried in Poets' Corner here

(5, 1).clue: Target audience of the national newspaper known as the "Weekly Reader"

(6, 1).clue: Since 1947, panels of journalists have questioned newsmakers on this Sunday show

(1, 2).clue: In 1819, Andrew Jackson & 2 partners founded this largest Tennessee city

(2, 2).clue: "Say anything you like about me except that I drink water," quipped this comic

(3, 2).clue: "Striking the flag" means lowering it at sea, or taking it down in the battle as a sign of this

(4, 2).clue: Surname of sibling poets Laura, William Rose & Stephen Vincent

(5, 2).clue: To set it apart from this city's tabloids, the new "News on Sunday" promised no photos of topless women

(6, 2).clue: In 1949 Uncle Miltie hosted the 1st of these on TV for the "Damon Runyon Memorial Fund"

(1, 3).clue: The part of U.S. Route 41 connecting these 2 Florida cities is called "The Tamiami Trail"

(2, 3).clue: "When I want to read a novel, I write one," said this novelist & Victorian prime minister

(3, 3).clue: The colors in common to the flags of Canada, Mexico, & the U.S.

(4, 3).clue: In 1818, Percy Bysshe Shelley moved to this country, where he wrote his greatest poems

(5, 3).clue: This multi-media mogul has added Harper & Row publishers to his stable of Aussie, U.S. & British holdings

(6, 3).clue: He was "At Large" in 1949 but was later captured to become "Today"s 1st host

(1, 4).clue: Half of Alabama's Ph.D.s live in this single city

(2, 4).clue: "I don't care what is written about me so long as it isn't true", stated this 4-time Oscar winner

(3, 4).clue: Name given the horizontal measurement of a flag, or Jeff Goldblum's noted 1986 role

(4, 4).clue: This Scottish author of "The Lay of the Last Minstrel" refused the post of poet laureate

(5, 4).clue: Educational publishing company that puts out Business Week Magazine

(1, 5).clue: Tho many say this Texas city is named for our 11th VP, its founder said he named it for a friend

(2, 5).clue: "When I split an infinitive...I split it so it will stay split", which explains Philip Marlowe's grammar

(3, 5).clue: The royal standard of England flies from a building only under this circumstance
(3, 5).correct response: when the monarch is in residence

(4, 5).clue: He had already published "Tamerlane & Other Poems" when he was appointed to West Point

(5, 5).clue: Tho Picture Week Magazine failed, this co. was still highest-ranked publisher for 1986 on the Fortune 500

(0, 0).clue: This foreign company, which didn't make any cars until early 1960s, is now 4th largest U.S. automaker
